head.supplied: 29 July 1881 ¶ ¶ Many months ago, dear Mr Wilson, a set of my works (elegantly bound) was forwarded to the Agent General for the Imperial Library of Vienne in exchange for a superb large illustrated ...

div.p: U81/6825, unit 1229, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; text-align: end; text-indent: 0.4929in;

div.p: The letter is undated; a note on the file cover provides the basis for dating it to 29 July. 29 July 1881

Many months ago, dear Mr Wilson, a set of my works (elegantly bound) was forwarded to the Agent General for the Imperial Library of Vienne in exchange for a superb large illustrated volume of Brazilian plants, obtained by the Emperor Maximilian of Mexico, which copy went to me and in the public Library of Melbourne.
See M to W. Odgers, 17 April 1880. I would just merely ask, whether any letter of acknowledgement of this return-gift was received from the Austrian Government.
See T. Wilson to M, 3 August 1881 (in this edition as 81-08-03a), and M to T. Wilson, 4 August 1881 (in this edition as 81-08-04a).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
